Authors: KURNIAWAN Y., LUHUKAY D., JOHAN, BHUTKAR G.
Title: Analysis of monitoring information system for production facilities support and agricultural business capital
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Centre of Excellence in HCI, Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Pune, India
Authors with affiliations: KURNIAWAN, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; LUHUKAY, D., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; JOHAN, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BHUTKAR, G., Centre of Excellence in HCI, Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Pune, India
Abstract: The results of the analysis of the running system shows that the problems faced by the organization today is tracking of realization and development information for the aid of production facilities and capital of agricultural business that has not been optimal. The purpose of this study is to analyse the needs of systems that support the implementation of aid monitoring. The information system of monitoring and evaluation of production facilities is considered to be the most appropriate to implement the strategy, as well as to overcome the problems occurring in the Ministry of Agriculture in relation to monitoring and evaluation of production facilities and agricultural business capital. The information system of monitoring and evaluation of production facilities and agricultural capital is an internet-based system to facilitate the Central Team (Minister of Agriculture and Technical Team of Directorate General), Provincial Agriculture Development Team, and Technical Team of Regency or Municipality Agriculture Office to access realization and development information for accurate agricultural business aid without being limited by space and time. © 2005 - ongoing JATIT & LLS.

Authors: Yohanes K., Junius K., Saputra Y., Sari R., Lisanti Y., Luhukay D.
Title: Unified Theory of Acceptance and Use of Technology (UTAUT) model perspective to enhance user acceptance of fintech application
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yohanes, K., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Junius, K., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saputra, Y., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sari, R., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lisanti, Y., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Financial Technology or called FinTech has brought a new color to the financial world. Some positive impacts of fintech development in Indonesia are the ease of financial services and completing the financial transaction chain. The purpose of this research is to evaluation an application Member XYZ using Unified Theory of Acceptance and Use of Technology (UTAUT) method. this research using quantitative method and processed the data using SmartPLS. The result from this research, some factors: Effort Expectancy, Social Influence, and Facilitating Conditions define as significant factor of user acceptance especially in fintech application. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Finance; Fintech; Technology; User acceptance; UTAUT
Index Keywords: Information management; Facilitating conditions; Financial service; Financial transactions; Indonesia; Quantitative method; Social influence; The unified theory of acceptance and use of technology(UTAUT); User acceptance; Fintech

Authors: Alaydrus M.F., Farhanudin F., Ismail F.S., Luhukay D.
Title: Designing Web-based Database Applications in CV Bahagia
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Alaydrus, M.F., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Farhanudin, F., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ismail, F.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this paper are to analyze, and design web-based database system for operational acitivities, that use to assets storage or company document as well as booking online from client to CV Bahagia. This paper consists of data collection methods which include observation, interview and research. The other method that used for this database design is Database System Development Life Cycle (DSDLC). The results achieved are speed up operational activity CV Bahagia and minimize the chance of fraud in operational activities perpetrated by staff who work in CV Bahagia. To improve the company's service, it is advisable to develop a live chat feature and custom design for stage and tent from client. So can more easily relate to client and can also fill orders in accordance with the wishes of the client. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Author Keywords: Database; Database System Development Life Cycle; System; Web
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Life cycle; Websites; Custom design; Data collection method; Database design; Operational activity; System; System development life cycles; WEB-BASED database; Web-based database systems; Database systems

Authors: Sari R., Lisanti Y., Luhukay D.
Title: The Evaluation of Impact Sharing Economy Critical Success Factor Implementation (case study: Online hospitality)
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sari, R., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lisanti, Y., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to make an assessment or impact related to the implementation of the Critical Success Factor of Sharing Economy specifically for online hospitality adopted the concept of sharing economy. The research methodology used is quantitative method where data will be collected through a questionnaire that will be distributed to various layers of the DKI Jakarta community, especially West Jakarta, which will then be processed using Smart PLS statistics. The expected results of this study are that the sharing economy industry, especially in the field of hospitality services, will develop its business more optimally, after implementing the critical success factors that have been studied previously. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Luhukay D., Kurniawan Y., Trisnio K., Prasetyo A., Pricensia C., Putra E., Famadi S.
Title: Development of ONCOM (Online Community) platform: A conceptual model
Source title: International Journal of Mechanical Engineering and Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Luhukay, D., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Trisnio, K., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prasetyo, A., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pricensia, C., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putra, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Famadi, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to know and analyse community needs based on current situation and condition, we designing community portal to support information requirement about member registration, member data, community data and event data from a community and to know how a community portal can help storage and the delivery of information about user and event data required can be available quickly and accurately for the members of the community portal. The method used by the author is literature and field study. The author uses the field method to conduct interviews and conduct surveys to find supporting data that helps in the development of information systems portal community. Based on the results of the study, it was found that the designed community portal can help to know the business process of one of the existing community at this time, to help facilitate the community in managing new user candidates as well as old user and event data that has been going on and will take place and facilitate the community in doing storage and delivery of information to users quickly and accurately. © IAEME Publication.

Authors: Kurniawan Y., Luhukay D., Simarmata Z.S., Aditya S., Manurung V.F.
Title: Analysis usage of social media Facebook as a learning media on senior high school (Case study)
Source title: International Journal of Mechanical Engineering and Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Simarmata, Z.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aditya, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Manurung, V.F., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: E-Learning is a distance learning method that used internet technology. With e-learning, learners can study anytime and anywhere. In this study, the authors want to investigate whether the use of social media Facebook as a tool of learning with e-learning method has or has no effect on the learning interest of senior high school students. Ninth grade student of XYZ school in Jakarta has been selected as the sample in this study. The Facebook group under the name Forum Diskusi Matematika XI (9th Math Discussion Forum) was created and carried out on the research for 40 days. After 40 days, the authors provide questionnaires and collect the opinions of students related to learning with Facebook e-learning that has been going on. From the data obtained and analyzed, it can be concluded that the use of Facebook as a tool of learning affect the interest of students of XYZ senior high school. © IAEME Publication
Author Keywords: E-learning; E-learning method; Facebook; Group; Questionnaires

Authors: Lisanti Y., Luhukay D., Mariani V.
Title: IT service and risk management implementation for online startup SME: Case study : Online startup SME in Jakarta
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lisanti, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mariani, V., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This in-progress research of IT service and risk management implementation for online startup SME is finding out on whether or not online startup SMEs are aware on the IT service and risk management, and how do they manage them. We found that local online startup SME professionals were aware of risks that might happened from IT services failure to their business, however, effort to manage the IT services were still minimum. It was due to the company size, as deploying a proper IT service and risk management are not cheap, hence there is no economic value to deploy an end to end IT service and risk management solution. In the other hand, they have never experienced a prolonged IT outage with severe damages. The research also showed that IRP (incident Resolution and Prevention) method to manage IT services availability is more suitable to be deployed by SME online business instead of Full ITIL (IT Infrastructure Library) method. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: IRP; IT service and risk management; IT service failure; ITIL; Online startup SME
Index Keywords: Information management; Company size; Economic values; In-progress research; It infrastructure libraries; IT services; ITIL; Online business; Online startup SME; Risk management

Authors: Lisanti Y., Luhukay D., Mariani V.
Title: SME's online business strategy to generate profits: Study case: PT IP vs. PT PS
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lisanti, Y., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Mariani, V., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Many free offers in internet has made startup online business owners struggle to pay their bills. At first, local startup online companies learned that free stuffs will attract traffics and once you get the traffic, revenue will follow. However, it doesn't come easily. PT IP, as a local online escrow service provider for C to C, transaction traffics were dropped to more than 80% after they start to charge the transactions with a very low administration fee. While PT PS, which offers part time jobs to freelancers, had a different strategy, they charged their services from the day one. This in-progress research found that creating traffics by giving free services to generate future revenue may not be suitable for SME (small to medium enterprise) due to capital limitation and lack of economic of scale, therefore start managing your online business revenue from the day one, stop giving free stuffs and start making money by managing valuable traffics. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Free Offers; Internet; Online Business; Revenue; SME; Startup; valuable traffics

Title: The impact of internet technology on creating new positions in Indonesia study case : Companies in Jakarta
Source title: Proceedings - 2015 International Conference on Science in Information Technology: Big Data Spectrum for Future Information Economy, ICSITech 2015
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Binus University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lisanti, Y., School of Information Systems, Binus University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., School of Information Systems, Binus University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Veronica, School of Information Systems, Binus University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Internet technology has changed many aspects in business these days, from new product and services development, to business process improvement such as online tender, mobile payment, online registration, and many others. As a result of those changes, companies need the right resources who understand on how to do business and compete in this new economy hence new competencies are hired. This research found many new positions have been created due to the changes, which do not exist in the past, or would sounds very strange 5 to 10 years ago. Positions such as social media specialist, mobile application developer or search engine optimization specialist are some of popular positions in Indonesia, especially in Jakarta. The research showed that internet has a positive impact on opening new jobs and creating new positions too in Indonesia. © 2015 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Indonesia; internet technology; new competencies; new economy; new jobs; new positions; positive impact; resources
Index Keywords: Internet; Search engines; Indonesia; Internet technology; new competencies; New economy; new jobs; New position; positive impact; resources; Big data

Title: The design of knowledge management system model for SME (UKM)
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Binus University, School of Information System, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lisanti, Y., Binus University, School of Information System, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., Binus University, School of Information System, Indonesia
Abstract: Studies on knowledge management showed that the knowledge management plays an important role to improve SME's performance, as knowledge or Information is one of innovation driver that will support the SME competitiveness. Therefore, in this study, together with KOPWANI UKM (SME) the team has designed a solution to manage the SME knowledge, called as SME Portal, which is a Knowledge Management System for SME. Furthermore, we also combined the Knowledge management system with social networking capability, as SME Portal members will get more benefit from the system namely to promote their products, to open business opportunities by extending their business networking, to find solution of their business problems. © 2005 - 2014 JATIT & LLS. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Information; Innovation; Knowledge management; Knowledge management system; Networking; SME; SME portal
References: Rasheed, N., (2005) The Impact Of Knowledge Management On Sme's, , Http://Www.Knowledgeboard.Com/Item/776/23/5/3; Setiarso, B., (2009) Pengelolaan Pengetahuan (Knowledge-Management) Dan Modal Intelektual (Intellectual Capital) Untuk Pemberdayaan Ukm, , www.ilmukomputer.com, Lembaga Ilmu Pengetahuan Indonesia; Ngah, R., Tacit Knowledge Sharing And Smes' Organizational Performance (2009) International Journal Of Economics And Finance, 1 (1). , Feb 2009; Mohayidin, M.G., The Application Of Knowledge Management In Enhancing The Performance Of Malaysian Universities (2007) The Electronic Journal Of Knowledge Management, 5 (3), pp. 301-312. , www.ejkm.Com, Available Online At; Turban, E., Volonino, L., (2010) Information Technology for Management: Transforming Organizations in the Digital Economy (Seventh ed.), , New Jersey: John Wiley & Sons; Satzinger, J.W., Jackson, R.B., Burd, S.D., (2009) System Analysis and Design In a Changing World (Fifth ed.), , Boston: Course Technology; Nonaka, I., Takeuchi, H., (1995) The Knowledge-Creating Company: How Japanese Companies Create The Dynamics Of Innovation, , Oxford University Press. Authors: Lisanti Y., Luhukay D., Veronica, Mariani V.
Title: The design of knowledge management system model for SME (Small and Medium Enterprise) (Phase 2-The pilot implementation in IT SMEs)
Source title: 2014 2nd International Conference on Information and Communication Technology, ICoICT 2014
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lisanti, Y., School of Information Systems, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., School of Information Systems, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Veronica, School of Information Systems, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Mariani, V., School of Information Systems, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: SME (Small and Medium Enterprise) or also known as UKM (Usaha Kecil dan Menengah) in Indonesia plays an important role to develop our economy, however, as we found not too many studies have been performed to improve its information management such as the knowledge management system, which we believe would facilitate new joiners to start up and also existing SMEs to grow their business, hence since 2013 the team has started to conduct a research in this area. This article will share our experience when we implemented the KMS for SME in several IT SMEs in Jakarta. We learned that choosing the right implementation approach, such as involving SMEs association, vendors/suppliers and professional to develop the content and encourage SMEs to participate, are crucial for the success of this project. © 2014 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Implementation approac; Information Management; KMS; Pilot project; SME; UKM
Index Keywords: Human resource management; Information management; Knowledge based systems; Implementation approac; KMS; Pilot projects; SME; UKM; Knowledge management
